Articles.Content:
My Minmas Refueling Depot spontaneously disintegrated into all of it's component parts...

Hours of work quickly converted into a rapidly expanding cloud of debris.

Well that looks spectacular, entertaining, and infuriating...

I had an instance of that once, but it was my fault. I had modified the wrong .cfg on a part I was working on and ended up shrinking the size of an adapter by a factor of ten. I had that adapter on the central hub of my Mun base. Loaded in, and the thing started to vibrate violently and exploded into a shower of parts. It was pretty fun to watch.

I had this happen as well while I had Kerbal Joint Reinforcement installed, always on scene load. It was less impressive than yours, though. Every single part would just fly off in a random direction at thousands of meters per second. I recently removed KJR and it hasn't happened since...
It's a RemoteTech error. Your ship was duplicated inside of itself, and when the physics were enabled after loading, KSP pooped its pants. I call it the Nightcrawler syndrome.
Well at least you have a Kerbal "Gravity" scenario to play around with.
I sense a disturbance in The Force...
The Kracken may have been a factor!
Now THAT... Is cool. Never seen that happen to me.

It's a RemoteTech error. Your ship was duplicated inside of itself, and when the physics were enabled after loading, KSP pooped its pants. I call it the Nightcrawler syndrome.

I also belive this is the reason, does anyone know why remotetech does that?

Idoes anyone know why remotetech does that?

Because you have been a bad Kerbal!

No, there is actually a temporary fix (a new .dll to be swapped for the faulty one) until Cilph gets around to finish the new update.

Check the forum thread, it usually gets reposted every odd page.

Scott had this also happen to his Interstellar Quest at 20m29s in the Video below.

Actually the Game duplicates a Ship and spawns both of them in the same Space.

I call it, the Duplication-Kraken
